algorithm.name: Selection sort
algorithm.description: An in-place sorting algorithm. Selection sort sorts the array by dividing the array into 2 parts, 1 sorted and the other is not, initially the sorted part is empty and the algorithm terminates when the sorted part is the entire array. Selection sort selects the min/max in each pass and places it at the correct position, causing the sorted part to increase by 1 and the unsorted part to decrease by 1. Selection sort has quadratic runtime even in the best case, however it makes the minimum possible number of swaps, n-1 swaps in the worst case.
algorithm.complexity: O(n^2), n - size of the array
